summary: The Veterans Jobs Opportunity Act proposes amending the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to establish a tax credit for veteran-owned small businesses creating businesses in underserved communities. The credit is 15% of qualified start-up expenditures, up to $50,000.  It defines qualified businesses, expenditures, and underserved communities.  It also includes provisions for electing the credit, special rules, and a report from the Treasury Inspector General.  The amendments are effective for tax years beginning after the Act's enactment.
